Package ui

Class Menu

java.lang.Object
ui.Menu
public class Menu
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Menu()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void createGame()
    User enters game parameters
    pre: the number of rows and columns has to be greater than 2 pre: the sum of the number of snakes and ladders must not be greater than half the rows on the game board post: Tthe game board is created according to the parameters entered by the user
    void createWorld​(java.lang.String parametros)
    The game board is created and the game is initialized
    pre: parameters have to be separated by spaces pre: you must have an entry for each parameter, none can be left empty post: the game table is created and the game is initialized
    void doOperation​(int option)
    Call the method that run the option chose by the user
    pre: The choice has to be an integer
    void gameSimulation()
    Run the entire game automatically without waiting for a player line break
    pre: the players must have been created previously pre: the game board must have been created previously post: the winner is saved with his nickname and score in the winners list
    void initializeGame()
    Read the game options
    pre: The user can't choose an option that's not on the options post: if the input is a line break, the game continues post: if the input was the word 'simul' then the 'simulation' mode is entered and the program runs automatically post: if the input was the word 'menu' then it returns to the menu post:if the input is different than expected, the program will do nothing and will ask the user to enter a valid option again post: if the input was the word 'num' it shows the initial table with the id of the nodes and the position of the stairs and snakes post: if someone won the current game, the program will ask you to enter your nickname and will calculate your score to add you to the winners list
    int readOption()
    Read and save an option that the user chose
    pre: The option has to be representated by an integer post: Return the integer choice
    void showMenu()
    Main menu of the application
    pre: The user can't choose an option that's not on the menu post: The user choose an option
    void startProgram()
    Run the whole application
    pre: The option has to be an integer post: Run the program

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      public void initializeGame()
      Read the game options
      pre: The user can't choose an option that's not on the options post: if the input is a line break, the game continues post: if the input was the word 'simul' then the 'simulation' mode is entered and the program runs automatically post: if the input was the word 'menu' then it returns to the menu post:if the input is different than expected, the program will do nothing and will ask the user to enter a valid option again post: if the input was the word 'num' it shows the initial table with the id of the nodes and the position of the stairs and snakes post: if someone won the current game, the program will ask you to enter your nickname and will calculate your score to add you to the winners list
